title: Digital Marketing Officer Job at Mephalti Technologies Limited
content:
Mephalti Technologies Limited is an emerging startup software company renowned for providing innovative, high-quality technology solutions and digital transformation services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Marketing Officer
Job Location: Benin, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Marketing
Reports To: Marketing Manager

Job Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a creative, data-driven Digital Marketing Officer to join our growing team. This individual will be responsible for executing online marketing strategies to increase brand awareness, generate leads, and enhance user engagement across digital platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and manage digital marketing campaigns across social media, email, SEO/SEM, and paid ads.
	Optimize content for the website and social networking channels such as LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and YouTube.
	Collaborate with the design and content teams to develop compelling campaigns.
	Conduct competitor and market research to guide strategies.
	Analyze digital data to draw key recommendations for future marketing campaigns.
	Track and report website traffic flow and provide internal reports regularly.
	Design and execute email marketing campaigns.
	Stay up to date with the latest digital marketing trends and best practices.


Qualifications / Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.
	 2+ years of experience in digital marketing or a related role.
	Proficient in Google Analytics, Google Ads, Facebook Business Manager, SEO tools, and CMS platforms (e.g., WordPress).
	Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking.
	Excellent communication and copywriting skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: mephaltihqrecruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Senior Accountant Job at Pause Factory Resources Limited
content:
Pause Factory Resources Limited - Our client, a Construction company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Accountant
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Our Client is seeking an experienced and highly skilled accounting professional to lead their accounting function, ensure compliance with accounting standards and regulatory requirements, and provide strategic financial guidance to support business growth.


Key Responsibilities of the Position
Financial Reporting:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepare and review financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements
	Ensure compliance with International Financial Reporting Standards and local accounting standards
	Coordinate the preparation of annual budgets and forecasts


Financial Planning and Analysis;


	Provide strategic financial guidance to support business growth and decision-making.
	Analyze financial data to identify trends, risks, and opportunities.
	Develop and implement financial models to support business planning.


Audit and Compliance;


	Coordinate the annual audit process, including preparation of audit schedules and responses to audit queries.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, including tax laws and company laws.
	Implement and maintain internal controls to ensure accuracy and integrity of financial data.


Annual Financial Statement and Reporting;


	Compute and prepare annual financial statements, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements.
	Prepare and submit annual financial reports to management, stakeholders, and regulatory bodies.
	Ensure timely and accurate submission of financial statements and reports.


Bank Relationships;


	Liaise with all banks to ensure smooth transactional operations.
	Manage bank accounts, including account opening, closing, and maintenance.
	Ensure compliance with bank regulations and requirements.


Leadership and Management:


	Lead and manage a team of accountants, providing guidance, training, and development opportunities.
	Coordinate the recruitment, training, and development of accounting staff.
	Implement and maintain accounting policies, procedures, and standards.


Job Specification


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or a related field.
	Minimum 8-15 years of experience in accounting, including 5 years in managerial level.
	Chartered Accountant (ACA, ACCA, or ICAN) qualification.
	Strong knowledge of IFRS and local accounting standards.
	Excellent analytical, communication, and leadership skills.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines.


Salary


	Negotiable.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their detailed Resume: jobs@pausefactory.org using "Senior Accountant" as the subject of the mail.
